meanings.definition: To erect or set up in advance.
meanings.sent1: The workers were preerecting the stage before the concert.
meanings.sent2: She always preerects the tent before going camping.
meanings.sent3: The students preerected their project to impress the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The chef preerected the dessert, ready to be served at the end of the meal.
meanings.sent5: Preerecting the decorations made the party setup much easier.

meanings.definition: The act of erecting or setting up in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preerecting of the scaffolding saved time during construction.
meanings.sent2: His preerecting of the exhibit showcased his organizational skills.
meanings.sent3: The preerecting of the Christmas tree brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent4: The preerecting of the stage set the tone for the upcoming performance.
meanings.sent5: The preerecting of the tent ensured a smooth camping experience.
